question: What is ComfyUI-N-Sidebar?
answer: ComfyUI-N-Sidebar is a simple sidebar extension for ComfyUI that adds features like drag and drop nodes, pinning favorite nodes, searching within nodes and categories, and custom categories.

question: How do I install ComfyUI-N-Sidebar?
answer: To install ComfyUI-N-Sidebar, clone the repository to your ComfyUI custom_nodes directory using the command: git clone https://github.com/Nuked88/ComfyUI-N-Sidebar.git

question: How do I update ComfyUI-N-Sidebar to the latest version?
answer: To update ComfyUI-N-Sidebar, navigate to the cloned repository folder custom_nodes/ComfyUI-N-Sidebar and run the command: git pull

question: What is the purpose of the settings.json file in ComfyUI-N-Sidebar?
answer: The settings.json file in ComfyUI-N-Sidebar stores the most important settings for the extension.

question: How can I set the workflows folder in ComfyUI-N-Sidebar?
answer: To set the workflows folder in ComfyUI-N-Sidebar, open the settings, go to WORKFLOW PATHS, and set the folder path to where your workflows are located. Restart ComfyUI for the changes to take effect.

question: Does ComfyUI-N-Sidebar support fuzzy search?
answer: Yes, ComfyUI-N-Sidebar has fuzzy search enabled by default, allowing for more flexible searching within nodes and categories.

question: How can I contribute to the development of ComfyUI-N-Sidebar?
answer: You can contribute to ComfyUI-N-Sidebar by reporting issues, suggesting improvements, or submitting pull requests on the GitHub repository.

question: Is ComfyUI-N-Sidebar an open-source project?
answer: Yes, ComfyUI-N-Sidebar is an open-source project licensed under the MIT License.
